alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 10:32PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion and central Putnam Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1032 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Lake Delancy, or 7 miles west of Pomona Park, moving southwest at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Palatka, Pomona Park, Salt Springs, East Palatka, Lake Delancy, Fruitland, San Mateo, Satsuma, Welaka and Hog Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam
